Updated November     pm







The UW will receive . million total from the federal CARES Act with . million going directly to students according to a briefing given to the Board of Regents on Thursday April  PERIOD

The Office of External Affairs expects to receive the funding by early next week PERIOD The U.S PERIOD Department of Education has advised schools to distribute these funds to students with a high financial need PERIOD

At the UW this would start with Husky Promise students but may expand to more students as administrators learn more information about disbursement mechanisms and could be expanded if more funding is awarded according to director of federal relations Sarah Martin Castro PERIOD

Every school is going to do it differently she said PERIOD Were going to be requesting more in upcoming stimulus packages this issue is not going away. the BOR also heard a briefing from Dr PERIOD Paul Ramsey the CEO of UW Medicine which has received over  million in donations to an Emergency Response Fund to support efforts to fight COVID19 PERIOD

UW coronavirus study highlights high mortality rate need for extensive ventilator support

UW alumni launch pledge to support small businesses amid COVID19 pandemic

UW to provide needbased grants using funding from federal stimulus package

A partisan pandemic Republican governors enacted COVID19 social distancing directives at slower rate than Democrats UW study finds

Summer quarter A term to be conducted remotely UW announces

Since they began preparing to treat those with COVID19 in late January UW Medicine has modified many existing protocols to adapt and identify isolate and care for patients under investigation for the virus PERIOD

They have also established testing sites at five UW Medicine facilities around Seattle and the UW Virology lab is able to test up to  per day PERIOD

Representatives from the UW Athletic Department also briefed the BOR on its compliance with NCAA recruitment standards and discussed the budget implications for studentathletes who had their seasons cut short by COVID19 PERIOD

Studentathletes are only eligible to play at the collegelevel for a certain number of seasons but those who were unable to compete in their  season were given another year of eligibility PERIOD The NCAAs decision applies to all spring season athletes but not winter season athletes who may have missed their postseason PERIOD

This has financial implications for scholarship budgets as many athletes have financial aid from the UW that may have to be provided for an extra year PERIOD

President Ana Mari Cauce also attended the meeting giving a rallying speech highlighting examples of resilience within the UW community such as staff writing in chalk all over campus to support custodians who have continued coming to work during Washingtons Stay Home Stay Healthy order PERIOD

Congress awarded  billion in emergency relief to U.S PERIOD higher education institutions last 

Cauce also addressed the UWs decision to cancel inperson graduation festivities for all three campuses substituting it with an online ceremony and an invitation for the class of  to physically walk with the class of  calling it a tough decision. she also said that the invitation for a joint ceremony with the class of  and  was not set in stone PERIOD

At this point whether itll be a ceremony of their own or whether theyll join the class of  marching well decide later once we know how many will participate she said PERIOD

Reach reporter Emma Scher at newsdailyuw.com PERIOD Twitter emmascherr

Considering tuition is just as expensive as it was before COVID19 I really dont understand what UW needs  million for PERIOD Waste of taxpayer dollars PERIOD
